subject: Amend to festival website - Alan Ayckbourn Two Plays
description:
Hi - wonder if you can advise on something?

We have a listing for an event taking place at two venues as below.
However, when it appears in search, and on the event page of the second venue, the dates show as the date span for both the venues combined. Hard to explain but hopefully the details below will explain...

Can this be altered?

Thanks

Chris


From: Ruth Puckering [mailto:Ruth.Puckering@sjt.uk.com]
Sent: 23 January 2012 10:30
To: Chris Adams
Cc: Sarah Lowry
Subject: RE: amend to festival website - Alan Ayckbourn Two Plays

Hi Chris,

I'm afraid they haven't changed - on the listings page here http://festival.london2012.com/events/search.php?categoryIds=&searchString=alan+ayckbourn&searchLocation=Town+or+Postcode&startDate=From+Date&endDate=To+Date&event-search-submit=Find+Events, and in the event details within each of the top two listings, the dates should be as below:

Stephen Joseph Theatre, Scarborough: 8 June - 28 July
Minerva Theatre, Chichester: 8 August - 8 September
Stephen Joseph Theatre, Scarborough: 10 September - 13 October

I don't mind of our overall dates read 8 June - 13 October if they have to, but Chichester's dates are wrong.
Many thanks,

Ruth

From: Chris Adams [mailto:Chris.Adams@london2012.com]
Sent: 20 January 2012 12:23
To: Ruth Puckering
Cc: Sarah Lowry
Subject: RE: amend to festival website - Alan Ayckbourn Two Plays

Hi Ruth and Sarah

Would you mind checking the Festival website to check the dates are now all correct?

Thanks


From: Louise Chantal
Sent: 19 January 2012 17:46
To: Eckhard Thiemann; Ruth Puckering
Cc: Sarah Lowry; Chris Adams
Subject: RE: amend to festival website - Alan Ayckbourn Two Plays

Thanks Eckhard, and hello Ruth!  Very much looking forward to working with you on this.

Chris and I actually thought there was something odd about the dates the other day, and I asked Tom Erhardt to check in with you about them (as the Chichester dates weren't yet public).  It's great to have these confirmed now. I think a previous email between myself and you must have gone awry.  I'm glad we're in touch now.

Thanks again. We can get this sorted very quickly.

Best wishes

Louise



________________________________
From: Eckhard Thiemann
Sent: 19 January 2012 17:40
To: Ruth Puckering
Cc: Sarah Lowry; Louise Chantal; Chris Adams
Subject: RE: amend to festival website - Alan Ayckbourn Two Plays
Dear Ruth
Thanks you for this.
You are right, I had to give up working on the Ayckbourn projects. When we reviewed all festival projects, we 'reshuffled' a bit the portfolio among the six producers. My colleague Louise Chantal is your contact. I very much enjoyed my visit to Scarborough and hope to still be seeing the plays.
But I also copy n my colleague Chris Adams, who can make changes to the website - Chris, can you please check the Stephen Joseph Theatre dates and can they be corrected?

Thanks and all the best
Eckhard

From: Ruth Puckering [mailto:Ruth.Puckering@sjt.uk.com]
Sent: 19 January 2012 17:34
To: Eckhard Thiemann
Cc: Sarah Lowry
Subject: amend to festival website - Alan Ayckbourn Two Plays

Hi Eckhard,

Amanda has told me that you're not our main contact any more, but I'm not sure who has taken over as our Cultural Olympiad liaison - please could you forward this on the relevant person?

There's an error on the website to do with the dates when the plays are in Chichester. The two plays start with us in Scarborough, then go to the Minerva Theatre, Chichester, before returning to finish with a run in Scarborough, which may be confusing but I'd be grateful if you could amend and make it as clear as possible on the website. The dates go as follows:

Stephen Joseph Theatre, Scarborough: 8 June - 28 July
Minerva Theatre, Chichester: 8 August - 8 September
Stephen Joseph Theatre, Scarborough: 10 September - 13 October


Best Wishes,

Ruth

Kieran, I have been looking at this and I don't quite get where the data are coming from:

Here's a search page: http://festival.london2012.com/events/search.php?categoryIds=&searchString=alan+ayckbourn

And here is what I think is the same results set: http://locog-events.gdp-events.com/controller.ws?method=search&searchString=alan+ayckbourn&startDate=28%2F10%2F2011

It looks like the "FROM: ... TO:..." text is being generated by a php method: dateRange2()

But I don't quite get where dateRange2() is getting its information from.
Chris, it looks like the dates in the data feed from the events database are inaccurate. You will need to login and update the records that we use to populate the website.

Hi Danny

I’ve altered the individual venue dates so they are now correct, but the search listings still show both venues as the full date range i.e.:

[cid:image001.png@01CCDB88.78944580]

Can you advise?

Thanks

Chris, you may need to wait a little while for the changes to be picked up. Otherwise, it is possible that there are still some fields that need amending. There is a "performace description" field which I think has been updated (I can see a change to the performance description on http://festival.london2012.com/events/9000961842), but there are also start-date and end-date fields, which are used in the search results page.

Hi Danny

The start and end dates are the ones I’ve amended and this is still showing in the search after a few hours. I haven’t altered the description but I don’t think this affects how the dates are displayed as it’s just free text?

Chris

Chris, many thanks for this. You have spotted an anomoly that in consultation with Wahome we have now fixed. We are now collecting the date information from the Timing Summary (as used on the event pages). 

Wahome also asked us to reverse the order of the venue and the dates. 

So instead of "FROM: 8 Jun 2012 TO: 13 Oct 2012, Minerva Theatre"

We now have: "Minerva Theatre, 08 Aug - 08 Sep 2012"


See e.g. http://festival.london2012.com/events/search.php?categoryIds=&searchString=alan+ayckbourn&searchLocation=Town+or+Postcode&startDate=From+Date&endDate=To+Date&event-search-submit=Find+Events

subject: Diagnostics tools for london2012
description:
Russ, we are proposing to write a command-line tool that we will install on all the london2012.com servers which will give diagnostic feedback on whether various web pages and services are running as expected.

The diagnostics are likely to include search services from Global Datapoint, Kitsite and (eventually) Earthware.

It may also include emdedded content from google, chartbeat, twofour, ecommera, stamen, edialog, and other services as required (although these are delivered client-side, so the information we can provide here is more limited).

Running the diagnostics would allow you to identify whether the unavailability of a site is due to the failure of one or more of the web servers or not; wether php or javascript code is failing on any one of a number of designated pages; whether response times are impaired in any way; and whether there are issues with connecting to any of the search services (or other APIs).

We think it's about a week's work to implement, test and deploy.

comments.value:
Russ, we are proposing to write a command-line tool that we will install on all the london2012.com servers which will give diagnostic feedback on whether various web pages and services are running as expected.

The diagnostics are likely to include search services from Global Datapoint, Kitsite and (eventually) Earthware.

It may also include emdedded content from google, chartbeat, twofour, ecommera, stamen, edialog, and other services as required (although these are delivered client-side, so the information we can provide here is more limited).

Running the diagnostics would allow you to identify whether the unavailability of a site is due to the failure of one or more of the web servers or not; wether php or javascript code is failing on any one of a number of designated pages; whether response times are impaired in any way; and whether there are issues with connecting to any of the search services (or other APIs).

We think it's about a week's work to implement, test and deploy.
To be run as a process on staging that runs every few mins and generates a page of diagnostics. Summary to Russ tomorrow, so he can raise a PO.

Additional requests:
- rsync - modification time of rsync log file (is there one?)
- apache - modification time of apache log file
- CMS publishing to staging - time of last publishing event (not sure the easiest way of doing that)

5 days total, including work already completed.

Interestingly, Russ has also asked for this in an XML format, because they want all their suppliers to run diagnostics into an application which they haven't yet built. They don't of course have a spec for the XML yet, let alone the application. This looks like a job we could pitch for if we were interested (although the support requirements don't bear thinking about--do we get called when an XML feed from delta tre fails at 3am in the middle of August?).
Marking as solved. It's here: http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com/healthcheck/

The issue appears to be that we are expecting a video width of 460px and we are getting a video width of 448px. We can change the default width on our video pages and re-publish the section, but it is probably worth checking whether 448px is in fact what you want before we do so. I don't quite understand how these widths got out of sync though.

No, I don’t either. Unless it has to do with the new mobile-optimised format?

I’ll take it up with TwoFour...

Lars, can I give this to you? I think it's relatively simple, i.e. change:

<object type="application/x-shockwave-flash" id="flashPlayer" name="flashPlayer" data="http://players.mediafreedom.twofourdigital.net/swf/player.swf" width="480" height="307">

to:

<object type="application/x-shockwave-flash" id="flashPlayer" name="flashPlayer" data="http://players.mediafreedom.twofourdigital.net/swf/player.swf" width="448" height="307">

And republish the section. Unless I have missed something.
Width="448"; height="363"; in function twoFourPlayer

Morag, we have amended the code. 

See https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/videos/2012/200-days-to-go-until-london-2012.php

It is still a bit mysterious to us how these got out of sync, but if you could confirm that this is what you want we will republish the entire section.
Looks much better. Can you republish the section (though do you need to? Does it affect every single video?)
Republished.

One possible solution:

Don't send any new password reminder requests after you have sent the first one. It does sometimes take a minute or two to arrive and if you are in hurry, the wait can be quite frustrating. 

If you send a second request for a password reset it can invalidate the first reset. This has happened to me in the past, and your description of this happening "a number of times" makes me think that this might be your problem--although I have just done a password reset myself and the email arrived within a minute.

Please do let us know how you get on.

Hi Uzma,

The problem is that Sarah (was) restricted to a specific section of the site and "restricted (to a section)" users need to select a section from the login drop down/screen when they login.

However we have long since stopped setting up user accounts in this was as it proved problematic/confusing (for the reasons Sarah just hit)

Danny probably wasn't aware of that when he setup Sarah's account as you can still setup users this way in the backend.

I've now removed the section limitation and Sarah should now be able to login as any other user,

Jamie

Er, not me guv--and for security reasons we are not supposed set up accounts these days anyway. Uzma set this one up herself--see http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/6372. Tom knows that Uzma can set up accounts and we have a pending ticket open for him to change this, which I reminded him about last week -- http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/6933

subject: ATR: Online form - applicant query
description:
From: Simon Knowles <Simon.Knowles@london2012.com>

It seems there’s a couple of glitches with the advertising/trading
form that you guys put together last year. I’d appreciate it if you
could investigate and fix where necessary. The first query sounds like
a glitch that needs sorting (hopefully fairly easily...). It only
seems to happen in IE, but is fine in FF.

I’ve not been involved until now, so not sure how to remedy the second
bug, but be grateful if you could advise.

Be good if you could sort the first one as soon as possible as
applications close in a few weeks time (thank God!).

Can you take a look and let me know?

From: advertisingandtradingenquiries
Sent: 17 January 2012 13:18
To: Simon Knowles
Cc: Alice Nugent
Subject: online form - applicant query

Hi Simon

I  know we said no more amendments, but the ‘type of licence’ boxes
does not show the full licence/regs name so applicants are not sure
they have made the right choice. This applies to both versions of the
form. Would Kitsite be able to widen the box so that all text is
visible?

There is also a problem with the licence expiry date for those who
have an existing licence. A lot of expiry dates are 31/07/2012 and the
website is not allowing applicants to submit forms with that date as
it does not cover the whole Games period (although applicants are
supposed to show a valid licence for Games Time, in practice these may
be not be renewed until nearer the time in which case we just need to
see a valid licence for the time of the application).  Is this a
Kitsite query, or one for James do you think? I’m not sure where the
responsibilities lie.

Give me a bell if you need me to clarify anything.

Thanks,

Sarah Clarke
Project Manager, Advertising & Trading
Olympic Delivery Authority
Direct line:  +44 (0) 203 023 6963

Marked as high.

Hi Simon,

1) ‘type of licence’ boxes does not show the full licence/regs name

Do you mean the drop down isn't fully expanding - width wise - on some browsers or is it actually missing options?

2) licence expiry date

Are you getting an error message at the top of the form when you enter "31/07/2012" (we can't see to recreate this) or is it an error when you import the data into ION (obviouyl if the latter it's an issue that needs to be raised with ION).

Jamie
Thanks for investigating. I've asked the AR team and will get back to you shortly. Simon

Jamie - see **** below

1) ‘type of licence’ boxes does not show the full licence/regs name

Do you mean the drop down isn't fully expanding - width wise - on some browsers or is it actually missing options?

**** The drop down isn’t fully expanding (certainly on Internet Explorer which I assume the majority of applicants will use).

2) licence expiry date

Are you getting an error message at the top of the form when you enter "31/07/2012" (we can't see to recreate this) or is it an error when you import the data into ION (obviouyl if the latter it's an issue that needs to be raised with ION).
**** The error appears to be at the online form end - applicants have said that they are unable to submit the form due to an invalid date of licence expiry. I haven’t been able to replicate this when I try, but we have had several emails now from people all with the same issue.

Actually I re-read both yours and Alice original email, so I think know the answer to my first question.

The drop down is an Internet Explorer specific issue in that technically drop downs (in Internet Explorer) can't expand wider than their closed state. We added some Javascript code in to try and work round this. 

We are just investigating why it's not working as expected (as it was previously). 

Unfortunately IE/Microsofts official response on this is that you can't do it and your drop downs must be no wider than the closed state.

Anyway, short answer is were investigating and hopefully will have a fix shortly (*)

(*) as it's such a common thing people want to do there are lots of workarounds, unfortunately they are all "workarounds" - it's not an officially supported feature in Internet Explorer.

With regards to the second issue, I wonder if people are entering a two digit year? 

We could allow either but I think ION expect a 4 digit year, so we may get a knock on issue if we do that.

Just checking..

(* we don't currently reformat the data we collect before sending it on to ION, we simply validate it, so it's not a trivial thing for us to just reformat the date, otherwise we would have accepted both formats and only sent the 4 year version).

Lars,

I fixed the second one, an over zealous date checker..

But the first is still an issue..

I've fixed the drop down expansion issue and its publishing. Its's a javascript/css fix so it will take a while to become visible on the live server but it should be working fine preview in internet explorer.

With regards to the issue applicants are having submitting the form,
when entering the wrong two digit year in the date format eg: (dd/mm/yy)
rather than (dd/mm/yyyy).

The text should read: 

Please note that the date should be entered in this format: dd/mm/yyyy 

 

Uzma

https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/making-it-happen/advertising-and-trading-regulations/applicationform.php

I haven't published the changes yet.
Lars

Thanks 
Uzma.

Hey Uzma, i've fixed those, please check! 

Cheers 
Lars

Thanks 

Uzma.

Ta

It is because Akamai is caching it.
 http://www.london2012.com/images/jobs/job-hub-hl.png
displays an akamai-cached image
 http://www.london2012.com/images/jobs/job-hub-hl.png?x=y
forces akamai to re-fetch it, and is thus your updated version.
The most effective way to fix this is probably just to rename the image
(which should force a republication of the jobs front, which should then
pick up the image at the new path)
Kieran
AS the image is hardcoded in the page will it pick up the new name of the file if I change it?

In short,

This has become a massive business risk.

If you could change the filename, and ensure that the template picks up the new image, I’d be very grateful.

Will happily explain the details via phone later.

Thanks,

Tom

Ok, apologies, I hadn't realized it was hard-coded into the template.
Will fix now.
K

Fixed.

Hi Tom,

"This has become a massive business risk"

For over six months now we have, on multiple occasions, expressed that LOCOG editorial (or ideally Kitsite) should have access to Akamai control panel and the ability to de-cache images/assets.

Given the the low levels of load currently on the server it may also be worth looking at reducing the levels of caching on images, down to say 30 mins, this will mean at most any given images will only be requested from the origin servers 48 times a day.

Jamie
Thank you very very much! ☺

Hi there,
I'm contacting you from the New Media Team at LOCOG. We're currently refining our SEO requirements for the Games Time Website which include our use of 301 redirects from the pre-games site.


It would be really helpful if you could provide some details on how 301 redirects are currently created and managed from with the Kitsite CMS. For example, whenever a CMS user changes the URL for a page or deletes a page, are they prompted to specify a 301 redirect for the URL of that page?

Hi Jacob,

The 301 redirects are handled on a manual basis in the CMS
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/admin/shorturls/

We have additional over time added in some more general / regular expression based 301 redirects to handle complete sections or more complex dynamic urls, these are added directly into the Apache .htaccess file as single mod_rewrite rules (which may apply to many urls/pages).

However, as you suggest many CMS now offer the ability to automatically create 301 redirects (from the old to the new location/filename) whenever a page is renamed or moved, which is a entirely sensible addition. 

Although I would consider limiting the ability of users to renaming section that contain a large number of pages or that are very deeply nested (or at least flag up the ganger in a alert box). As an action like that could cause a huge number of redirects being written out. If you do need to rename sections with may sub-pages it may be better to use a single regular expression based mod_rewrite (or equivalent server side redirect) rule in a server config.

The other important thing to check here is that your CMS tracks all the previous redirects in such a way that they all point to a single canonical 'current' url, as opposed to them chaining, or else you may end up with "to many redirect' errors.

We also implement what we term 'SEO urls'
These are less 'redirects' in the 301 sense and more 'neat' short urls (ie. /basketball) that are inserted into href tags by the CMS instead of the full path to the page (ie. /sport/basketball.php). With these pages the name of the 'short' name of page stays the same regardless of where it lives in the site structure. However I think this may be more specific to our current CMS implementation which has a strong notion of a hierarchical site structure that mates that of the live site in the editorial interfaces.
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/admin/seopaths/

In terms of how to implement the redirects, that will largely depend on your CMS, but I would say you would want to do this somewhere centrally (ie. a server config, a controller, a global request handler) rather than physically replacing the old pages with a page that does the redirect (otherwise you run the risk of having redirects to redirects).

I hope that answers your questions..

Jamie

Hi Jamie,
Thanks so much for getting back to me. This is really helpful. Would it be possible to get a copy of the .htaccess file please? We can't extract a list of the singularly mapped (i.e. 1-1 mapped) URLs and wonder if it excludes all the mod_rewritten stuff too.
Any further help greatly appreciated,
Jacob

Hi Jacob,

You can access it here in the CMS
https://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/.htaccess

The block named "MARKETING REDIRECTS" are the ones constructed out of the CMS via the "Short URL" screen/interface.
